(base) ¶ Is ther any coper her Inne seyde he ;
(base) ¶ Ye quod the preest sir I trowe wel ther be
(base) ¶ Elles go bye vs som / and that as swithe

(base) Of this Chanoun / roote of alle cursednesse

(base) It weerieth me / to telle of his falsnesse

(base) Stoupeth adoun / by god ye be to blame

(base) Putte In youre hand / and looketh what is theer

(base) For by my feith / I nolde for myn hood

(base) And that as swithe / preeued it shal bee
(base) ¶ Vn to the Goldsmyth / with thise teynes three
(base) They wente / and putte thise teynes in assay
(base) To fir and hamer / myghte no man seye nay

(base) ¶ This sotted preest . who was gladder than he
(base) Was neuere brid / gladder agayn the day
(base) Ne nyghtyngale / in the sesoun of May
(base) Nas neuere man / that luste bet to synge
(base) Ne lady / lustier in carolynge
(base) Or for to speke of loue and wommanhede
(base) Ne knyght in Armes / to doon an hardy dede
(base) To stonden in grace / of his lady deere
(base) Than hadde this preest this soory craft to leere

(base) For loue of god / that for vs alle deyde
(base) And as I may / deserue it vn to yow
(base) What shal this receite coste / telleth now
(base) ¶ By oure lady quod this Chanoun / it is deere
(base) I warne yow wel / for saue I and a frere

(base) Ye shul paye fourty pound / so god me saue
(base) And nere the freendshipe / that ye dide er this
(base) To me / . ye sholde paye moore ywis
(base) ¶ This preest the some of fourty pound anon
(base) Of nobles fette / and took hem euerichon
(base) To this Chanoun / for this ilke receit
(base) Al his werkyng nas but fraude and deceit
(base) ¶ Sir preest he seyde / I kepe han no loos
(base) Of my craft / for I wolde it kept were cloos
(base) And as ye loue me / kepeth it secree
(base) For and men knewen / al my soutiltee
(base) By god / they wolden han so greet enuye
(base) To me / by cause / of my Philosophye

(base) Quod the Chanoun / and farwel grant Mercy
(base) He wente his wey / and neuer the preest hym sy
(base) After that day / and whan that this preest shoolde
(base) Maken assay / at swich tyme as he wolde
(base) Of this receit / farwel / it wolde nat be

(base) To brynge folk to destruccioun
(base) COnsidereth sires / how that in ech estaat
(base) Bitwixe men and gold / ther is debaat
(base) So ferforth / that vnnethe is ther noon
(base) This multiplying blent so many oon
(base) That in good feith / I trowe that it bee
(base) The cause grettest of swich scarsetee

div.l: (base) For any wit that men han now adayes
(base) They mowe wel chiteren / as that doon Ioyes
(base) And in hir termes / sette hir lust and peyne
(base) But to hir purpos / shul they neuere atteyne
(base) A man may lightly lerne / if he haue aught
(base) To multiplie / and brynge his good to naught
(base) ¶ Lo / swich a lucre / is in this lusty game
(base) A mannes myrthe / it wol turne vnto grame
(base) And empten also / grete and heuye purses
(base) And maken folk / for to purchacen curses
(base) Of hem / that han hir good / ther to ylent
(base) Fy for shame / they that han been brent
(base) Allas / kan they nat flee / the fires heete
(base) Ye that it vse / I rede ye it leete
(base) Lest ye lese al / for bet than neuere is late
(base) Neuere to thryue / were to long a date
(base) Though ye prolle ay / ye shul it neuere fynde
(base) Ye been as boold as is Bayard the blynde
(base) That blondreth forth / and peril casteth noon
(base) He is as boold / to renne agayn a stoon
(base) As for to goon / bisides in the weye
(base) So faren ye / that multiplie I seye
(base) If that youre eyen / kan nat seen aright

(base) For though ye looken neuer so brode and stare
(base) Ye shul no thyng wynne on that chaffare
(base) But wasten / al that ye / may rape and renne
(base) With draweth the fir / lest it to faste brenne
(base) Medleth namoore / with that Art I mene
(base) For if ye doon / youre thrift is goon ful clene
(base) And right as swithe / I wol yow tellen heere
(base) What that the Philosophres seyn in this mateere
(base) LO / thus seith Arnold of the newe toun
(base) As his Rosarie / maketh mencioun
(base) He seith right thus / with outen any lye
(base) Ther may no man / Mercurie mortifie
(base) But it be / with his brother knowlechyng

div.l: (base) He seith / how that the dragon doutelees

(base) By the dragon / Mercurie and noon oother
(base) He vnderstood / and Brymstoon by his brother
(base) That out of Sol / and Luna were ydrawe
(base) And therfore seyde he / taak heede to my sawe
(base) Lat no man bisye hym / this Art for to seche
(base) But if that he / the entencioun and speche
(base) Of Philosophres / vnderstonde kan
(base) And if he do / he is a lewed man
(base) For this science / and this konnyng quod he
(base) Is of the secree / of the secretes perdee
(base) ¶ Also / ther was a disciple of Plato
(base) That on a tyme / seyde his maister to
(base) As his book senior / wol bere witnesse
(base) And this was his demande in soothfastnesse
(base) Telle me the name / of the priuee stoon
(base) ¶ And Plato answerde / vn to hym anoon
(base) Take the stoon / that Titanos men name
(base) ¶ Which is that quod he ; Magnasia is the same
(base) Seyde Plato / ye sire / and is it thus ;
(base) This is / ignotum per ignocius ;
(base) What is Magnasia / good sire I yow preye ;
(base) ¶ It is a water / that is maad I seye
(base) Of elementes foure quod Plato
(base) ¶ Telle me the roote / good sire quod he tho
(base) Of that water / if it be youre wille
(base) ¶ Nay nay quod Plato / certein that I nylle
(base) The Philosophres / sworn were euerychoon
(base) That they sholdem discouere it vn to noon
(base) Ne in no book it write / in no manere
(base) For vn to Crist / it is so lief and deere
(base) That he wol nat that it discouered bee
(base) But where it liketh / to his deitee
(base) Men for tenspire / and eek / for to deffende

(base) ¶ Thanne conclude I thus / sith that god of heuene

div.l: (base) Ne wil nat that the Philosophres neuene
(base) How that a man / shal come vn to this stoon

(base) For who so / maketh god his Aduersarie
(base) As for to werken / any thyng in contararie
(base) Of his wil / certes neuer shal he thryue
(base) Thogh that he multiplie terme of lyue
(base) And there a poynt for ended is my tale
(base) God sende euery trewe man / boote of his bale Amen ~
(base) ¶ Heere is ended the Chanouns Yemannes tale ~
(base) ¶ The Prologe / of the Persons tale
(base) By that the Maunciple hadde his tale al ended
(base) The Sonne // fro the South lyne is descended
(base) So lowe / that he nas nat to my sighte
(base) Degrees . 29 . as of highte
(base) Ten of the Clokke / it was so as I gesse
(base) For eleuene foot and litel moore / or lesse
(base) My shadwe was / at thilke tyme as there
(base) Of swiche feet / as my lengthe parted weere
(base) In . 6 . feet equal / of proporcioun
(base) Ther with / the Mones exaltacioun
(base) I mene Libra / alwey gan ascende
(base) As we were entryng at a Thropes ende
(base) For which oure hoost as he was wont to gye
(base) As in this cas / oure Ioly compaignye
(base) Seyde in this wise / lordynges euerichon
(base) Now lakketh vs / no tales / mo than oon
(base) Fulfild is my Sentence / and my decree

(base) Almoost fulfild is al myn ordinaunce
(base) I pray to god / so yeue hym right good chaunce
(base) That telleth this tale / to vs lustily
(base) Sire preest quod he / artow a Vicary

(base) Be what thow be / ne breke thow nat oure pley

div.l: (base) For trewely / me thynketh by thy cheere
(base) Thow sholdest / knette vp wel a greet matere
(base) Telle vs a fable anon / for Cokkes bones
(base) This parson / answerde al atones
(base) Thow getest fable noon / ytoold for me
(base) For Poul / that writeth vnto Thymothe
(base) Repreueth hem / that weyuen Soothfastnesse
(base) And tellen fables / and swich wrecchednesse
(base) Why sholde I sowen draf out of my fest
(base) Whan I may sowen whete / if that me lest
(base) For which I seye / that if yow list to heere
(base) Moralitee / and vertuous matere
(base) And thanne / that ye wol yeue me Audience
(base) I wole ful fayn / at Cristes reuerence
(base) Do yow plesance / leueful / as I kan
(base) But trusteth wel / I am a Southren man
(base) I kan nat geste / rom / ram / ruf / by lettre
(base) Ne god woot rym holde I but litel bettre
(base) And therfore if yow lest I wol nat glose
(base) I wol yow telle / a myrie tale in prose
(base) To knytte vp al this feste / and make an ende
(base) And Ihu for his grace / wit me sende
(base) To shewe yow the wey / in this viage
(base) Of thilke parfit glorious pilgrymage
(base) That highte Ierusalem celestial
(base) And if ye vouche sauf anon I shal
(base) Bigynne vpon my tale / for which I preye
(base) Telle youre auys / I kan no bettre seye
(base) But nathelees / this meditacioun
(base) I putte it ay / vnder correccioun
(base) Of clerkes / for I am nat textuel
(base) I take but the sentence / trusteth wel
(base) Therfore / I make protestacioun
(base) That I wol stonde / to correccioun
(base) Vpon this word / we han assented soone
(base) For as it semed / it was for to doone
(base) To enden / in som vertuous sentence

div.l: (base) And bede oure hoost he sholde to hym seye
(base) That alle we / to telle his tale hym preye
(base) Oure hoost hadde the wordes for vs alle
(base) Sire preest quod he / now faire yow bifalle
(base) Sey what yow list and we wol gladly heere
(base) And with that word / he seyde in this manere
(base) Telleth quod he / youre meditacioun
(base) But hasteth yow / the sonne wole adoun
(base) Beth fructuous / and that in litel space
(base) And to do wel / god sende yow his grace

div.ab: (base) Iere 6o State super vias et videte et interrogate de semitis antiquis que sit via bona et ambulate in ea et inuenietis refrigerium animabus vestris et cetera
(base) Here bigynneth the Persons tale
(base) Ovre swete lord god of heuene that no man wole perisse but wole that we comen alle to the kNoweliche of hym and to the blisful lyf that is pardurable
(base) amonesteth vs by the prophete Ieromie that seith in this wise
(base) Stondeth vp on the weyes and seeth and axeth of olde pathes that is to seyn of olde sentences which is the goode wey
(base) and walketh in that wey and ye shal fynde refresshynge for youre soules et cetera
(base) Manye been the weyes espirituels that leden folk to oure lord Ihesu crist and to the regne of glorie
(base) of whiche weyes ther is a ful noble wey and a ful couenable which may nat faile to man ne to womman that thurgh synne hath mysgoon fro the righte wey of Ierusalem celestial
(base) and this wey is clepid Penitence of which men sholde gladly herknen and enquere with al his herte
(base) to wite what is penitence and whennes it is clepid penitence and in how manye maneres been the accions or werkynges of penitence
(base) and how manye spices ther ben of penitences and whiche thynges apertenen and bihouen to penitence whiche thynges destourben penitence
(base) Seint Ambrose seith that penitence is the pleynynge of man for the gilt that he hath doon and namoore to doon any thyng for which hym oghte to pleyne

Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image. (base) And som dectour seith Penitence is the waymentynge of man that sorweth for his synne and pyneth hym self for he hath mysdoon
(base) Penitence with certeyne circumstances is verray repentance of a man that halt hym self in sorwe and oother peyne for hise giltes
(base) and for he shal be verray penitent he shal first biwailen the synnes that he hath doon and stedefastly purposen in his herte to haue shrift of mouthe and to doon satisfaccioun
(base) and neuere to doon thyng for which hym oghte moore to biwaile or to compleyne and to continue in goode werkes or ellis his repentance may nat auayle
(base) For as seith Seint Isydre he is a Iapere and a gabbere and no verray repentant that eft soone dooth thyng for which hym oghte repente
(base) wepynge and nat for to stynte to do synne may nat auaile
(base) But nathelees men shal hope that at euery tyme that man falleth be it neuer so ofte that he may arise thurgh penitence if he haue grace but certeynly it is greet dowithe
(base) for as seith Seint Gregorie vnnethe ariseth he out of his synne that is charged with the charge of yuel vsage
(base) and ther fore repentant folk that stynte for to synne and forlete synne er that synne forlete hem holy chirche halt hem siker of hire sauacion
(base) and he that synneth and verraily repenteth hym in his laste holy chirche yet hopeth his sauacioun by the grete mercy of oure lord Ihesu crist for his repentance but taak the siker wey
(base) and Now sith that I haue declared yow what thyng is penitence Now shul ye vnderstonde that ther been iij accions of penitence
(base) The firste is that if a man be baptised after that he hath synned
(base) Seint Augustyn seith but he be penitent for his olde synful lyf he may nat bigynne the newe clene lyf
(base) for certes if he be baptised with oute penitence of his olde gilt he receyueth the mark of baptesme but nat the grace ne the remissioun of hise synnes til he haue repentance verray
(base) Another defaute is this that men doon deedly synne after that they han receyued baptesme
(base) The thridde defaute is that men fallen in venyal synnes after hire baptesme fro day to day
(base) ther of seith Seint Augustyn That penitence of goode and of humble folk is the penitence of euery day
(base) The speces of penaunce been iij that oon of hem is solempne Another is commune and the thridde is priuee
(base) Thilke penaunce that is solempne is in two maneres as to be put out of holy chirche in lente for slaughtre of children and swich manere thyng

Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image. (base) Another is whan man hath synned openly of which synne the fame is openly spoken in the contree and thanne holy chirche by Iugement destreyneth hym for to doon open penance
(base) Commune penaunce is that preestes enioynen men communly in certeyn cas as for to goon parauenture naked in pilgrymage or barefoot
(base) Pryuee penaunce is thilke that men doon al day for priuee synnes of whiche we shryue vs pryuely and receyue pryuee penance
(base) Now shaltow vnderstande what bihoueth and is necessarie to verray parfit penitence and this stant on iij thynges
(base) Contricioun of herte Confessioun of Mouth and Satisfaccioun

(base) for which seith Seint Iohn Grisostomus Penitence destreyneth man to accepte benygnely euery peyne that hym is enioyned with contricioun of herte and shrift of Mowithhe with satisfaccioun and in wirkynge of alle manere humylitee
(base) and this is fruytful penitence agayn iij thynges in whiche we wrathe oure lord Ihesu crist
(base) this is to seyn by delit in thynkynge by recchelesnesse in spekynge by wikked synful wirkynge
(base) and agayns thise wikkede giltes is penitence that may be likned vn to a tree
(base) The roote of this tree is contricioun that hideth hym in the herte of hym that is verray repentant right as the roote of a tree hideth hym in the erthe
(base) Of the roote of Contricioun spryngeth a stalke that bereth branches and leues of confessioun and fruyt of satisfaccioun

(base) for which crist seith in his gospel dooth digne fruyt of penitence for by this fruyt may men kNowe this tree and nat by the roote that is hyd in the herte of man ne by the branches ne the leues of Confessioun
(base) And therfore oure Lord Ihesu crist seith thus by the fruyt of hem shul ye kNowe hem
(base) Of this roote eek spryngeth a Seed of grace the which Seed is moder of Sikernesse and this Seed is egre and hoot
(base) the grace of thys Seed spryngeth of god thurgh remembrance on the day of dome and on the peynes of helle
(base) Of this matere seith Salomon that in the drede of god man forleteth his synne
(base) the hete of thys seed is the loue of god and the desirynge of the Ioye pardurable
(base) this hete draweth the herte of man to god and dooth hym hate his synne
(base) for soothly ther is no thyng that sauoureth so wel to a child as the mylk of his norice ne no thyng is to hym moore abhomynable than thilke mylk whan it is medled with oother mete
(base) right so the synful man that loueth his synne hym semeth it is to hym moost swete of any thyng

Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image. (base) but fro that tyme that he loueth sadly oure lord Ihesu crist and desireth the lyf pardurable ther nys to hym no thyng moore abhomynable
(base) for soothly the lawe of god is the loue of god for which Dauid the prophete seith I haue loued thy lawe and hated wikkednesse and hate he that loueth god kepeth his lawe and his word
(base) this tree saugh the prophete Daniel in Spirit vp on the auysion of Nabugodonosor whanne he conseiled hym to do penitence
(base) Penance is the tree of lyf to hem that it receyuen and he that holdeth hym in verray penitence is blessed after the Sentence of Salomon

(base) In this penitence or Contricioun man shal vnderstonde iiij thynges that is to seyn what is Contricioun and whiche ben the causes that moeuen a man to Contricioun and how he sholde be contrit and what Contricioun auaileth to the soule
(base) thanne is it thus that Contricioun is the verray sorwe that a man receyueth in his herte for hise synnes with sad purpos to shryue hym and to do penance and neuere moore to do synne
(base) and this sorwe shal ben in this manere as seith Seint Bernard It shal ben heuy and greuous and ful sharpe and poynaunt in herte
(base) first for man hath agilt his lord and his Creatour and moore sharp and poynaunt for he hath agilt his fader celestial
